message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and Innovation Follow-Up Surveys, we examine the relationship between high-growth firms and innovation in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Innovation Follow-Up Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on longitudinal data from the years 2010–2018 collected by National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control (NAFDAC) to investigate trends in prevalence of poor quality drugs in West Africa.", "dataset": ["National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control (NAFDAC)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from Living Standards Measurement Study – Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA), which collects detailed consumption and expenditure information from households in Sub-Saharan Africa, to examine the impact of agricultural extension programs on agricultural productivity.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study – Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Using a unique dataset that combines satellite-derived data with household survey data from Nigeria, we estimate the impact of electrification on welfare outcomes.", "dataset": ["satellite-derived data", "household survey data from Nigeria"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes multiple datasets to analyse the impact of natural disasters on inequality in developing countries.", "dataset": ["multiple datasets"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management ", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "To evaluate the effectiveness of an education intervention programme, we rely on data from Uganda National Panel Survey and Demographic and Health Surveys.", "dataset": ["Uganda National Panel Survey", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "The study uses a dataset on foreign acquisition transactions and related deal characteristics available in the Zephyr database to explore the impact of cross-border M&As on competition.", "dataset": ["Zephyr database"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Investigating the factors that explain variations in industrial policy outcomes, this study utilises data from the UNIDO Industrial Statistics Database and the World Development Indicators compiled by the World Bank Group.", "dataset": ["UNIDO Industrial Statistics Database", "World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "The analysis is based on two datasets - panel data on workers and industries from Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Mexico, and Peru gathered from the IDB Labor Market Information Portal and counterfactual simulations obtained from linked worker-firm production microdata from the Brazilian Annual Services Survey.", "dataset": ["panel data on workers and industries from Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Mexico, and Peru gathered from the IDB Labor Market Information Portal", "linked worker-firm production microdata from the Brazilian Annual Services Survey"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses a unique dataset on conflict events in India between 2005 and 2015 and their coverage in Indian English language newspapers to analyze media coverage of conflicts and its implications for individuals’ political attitudes.", "dataset": ["unique dataset on conflict events in India between 2005 and 2015"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "Using nationally representative household surveys, we analyse the impacts of cash transfers on nutritional outcomes for young children, accounting for seasonal fluctuations in food prices and availability through a rich set of monthly food price and nutrition datasets.", "dataset": ["nationally representative household surveys", "monthly food price and nutrition datasets"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Social Protection"]}]
